channel.title: Giving path

item.title: Giving path
item.dc:creator: @Sagi Sagi
item.description:
@Sagi wrote:

thats what i had…i told you that i got java in E:\Java\bin , and not that programme files can you tell me a code according to my installation…

Read full topic

item.title: Giving path
item.dc:creator: @x_sam_x1 x sam x
item.description:
@x_sam_x1 wrote:

try this @echo off Title Compiler cd Client Files if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic

item.title: Giving path
item.dc:creator: @Sagi Sagi
item.description:
@Sagi wrote:

I got this when i enter that…
Error:

the system cannot find the path specified.
javac: directory not found ./bin/
Usage: javac
use -help for a list of possible options
Press any key to continue…

Read full topic

item.title: Giving path
item.dc:creator: @x_sam_x1 x sam x
item.description:
@x_sam_x1 wrote:

Try a simple compiler code then if it still says you do not have java installed, you have not set your environment variables. Here use my simple compiler code: @echo off title Sams Compiler cd Source "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_##\Bin\javac.exe" -cp . -d ./Bin/ ./*java pause
change ## to your version of java.

Read full topic

item.title: Giving path
item.dc:creator: @Sagi Sagi
item.description:
@Sagi wrote:

I got compiler and other set with some this code:

@echo off
@TITLE Reality’s Compiler
if exist “%programfiles%\Java” (call :compile “%programfiles%\Java”) else (goto error)
:compile
for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe")
if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java)
if defined p (goto end)
:error
echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load.
:end
echo Finished!
pause
exit

I got Java installed in E:\Java\bin[all that files]
How should I edit this code, because it seems to me very unique so guys please reply to me as fast as fast as possible.

Read full topic
